name: fuckyoufriday

name: deimosrising
text: Ray Smuckles is among the most successful businessmen in the world today.

name: drskradley

name: drskradley
text: LADY LUCK FUCKS BALD CATS

text: no ti ssap

text:
party party
party hard
i view partying with
fond regard

name: luckypyjamas
text:
party in a dude's backyard

i had strongly considered including that quote but i thought it might be a little obvious given my avatar

name: trollcollins
text: Behind every great man is a nervous man with a really high-powered brain.

name: johnnyc
text: And wireless internet lodged in his body.

name: spinynorman
text:
Beef is there to make sure that Ray doesn't get blazed and show up at a press conference looking like Jack White, Marlon Brando, or perhaps the gentleman pictured below:

[IMGS OFF]

name: lost_buoy
text:
Noriega was always such a whimsical cat/
His shirts were oft kooky, not to mention his hat.

name: trollcollins
text:
Context!

My brain aches for want of context!

name: spinynorman
text:
To be honest, if memory servers, it has something to do with Britney Spears.

Probably complicates things more.

name: spinynorman
text: oh how memory severs

name: soticoto
text: Memory servers just made more sense to me. I just imagined you tapping into one of your many external terrabyte-drives to dig up the required data and perhaps an accompanying story.

name: spectre
text: I have worked for the Florida Democratic Party through two election cycles. You do NOT know how true this is (except you missed out on the nervouc overweight woman BEHIN D the skinny guy).

name: cousinted
text: Beef makes the trains run on time.

name: neonaoneo
text: Funniest comic in a while, and I wholly agree with Ray's sentiments

name: baryonyx
text:
RAY SMUCKLES
[IMGS OFF]
IS WATCHING YOU

name: myrrdisparo
text: I want this on a sticker, or maybe a button, all 1984 style

name: cousinted
text: [img]http://i159.photobucket.com/albums/t158/cousinted/rayposse.jpg,/img]

name: cousinted
text:
Let's try that again, shall we?

[IMGS OFF]

name: jordstar
text:
*Eighty* pounds?

Somebody better tell Guinness they screwed up.

Have you ever picked up a cat?

name: cousinted
text: Well...DJ Ray got awful chubby this year.

name: gormster
text: Given that the titles appear to be in a Germanic language (which wasn't English) I would hazard a guess that the scale was in kilograms, not pounds.

name: jordstar
text:
[url=http://www.google.ca/search?hl=en&q=world%27s fattest cat pounds&btnG=Search&meta=]Nope![/url]

You guys insist that cats are filled with lead or something. I'm just trying to set you straight. Don't want to see a fellow AcheWorlder get stuck in Hell when the Friendly's menu asks how much most cats weigh.

name: jordstar
text: Assetbar, you have problems with googling "world's fattest cat pounds" or something. Not my problem.

name: falseprophet
text:
[IMGS OFF]
Ray Smuckles knew back then that this civil rights thing would be hott today. He pays attention.

name: barrylegg
text: A comment left by barrylegg was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by pmoney187, Vice, wargasmic, theoneyouwant, abbaZaba, atticusonline, IronDave, gbeaton, lastlarf, Mastronaut)

name: norrin
text: I...I don't understand. I wonder if the lamers do understand and don't like it, or if they just dislike what they don't understand.

name: wargasmic
text: I understand perfectly. Barrylegg is being picky about debatable BMX terminology.

name: norrin
text: For some reason I had never read the alt-text until now.

name: audhumla
text: I grudgingly gave him a chubby because our avatars are closely related.

name: tekende
text: Not that close. Is not like they are speakink at Christmas.

name: stuntman
text: nobody likes a "knowitall"

name: i_love_kate
text: Classic Brick.

name: proof_man
text: not the mayor!

name: proof_man
text: phillippe must be losing his shit.

name: velvetpresley
text:
Yeah, we've got to hope for some sort of arc based on Phillippe's grief over the loss of the old Mayor and massive excitement about Ray becoming the new Mayor.

Such mayoral emotion must be difficult to deal with at any age.

name: retinarow
text:
If you're having trouble with mayoral emotion, may I humbly suggest:

[IMGS OFF]

name: grayfox
text: Is this strip the fascination or the fallout?

name: baryonyx
text: The fallout. Just observing mayors no longer satisfies; you've got to become one to get a buzz.

name: falseprophet
text: You got to become the ruling body. There comes a time.

name: wittyname
text: Phillipe will most likely lead a coup to take over the office.

name: sexualhomeboy
text: By shocking Ray's dick.

name: usversusthem
text: The reply/avatar/name combo here is truly magnificent.

name: velvetpresley
text: Pesky free papers messing with my grocery stores...

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Man, this is not a problem in my area. I guess I should be pleased?

name: swanny614
text: You should write your local representative and thank him or her.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: I guess according to this comic I should credit the mayor. Thank you, Michael Bloomberg! Enjoy your quixotic quest for the presidency!

name: synnah
text: I wonder if Ray will be able to reinstate Philippe's mayor fascination. I do hope so.

name: woodenteeth
text: Ray is somewhere near 500  points up in Kenya right now...

name: bjorntd
text: Holy Shit, Ray is my mayor.

name: bjorntd
text: I suppose this bears explaining: I live in Palo Alto, which the Achewood map is based on, so I always figure that Achewood=Palo Alto, because I'm self-important that way.

name: odei
text: Has Larry Klein had any heart problems recently?

name: bjorntd
text: To be honest there is such little civic identity in this town that I do not even know who my mayor is.

name: loneal
text: We share a mayor, bjorntd. I don't know who our mayor is in real life, either, but I do know that it is Ray Smuckles in my heart.

name: bjorntd
text: I believe I just got lamed for not knowing who my mayor is.

name: loneal
text: Or maybe for accusing Palo Alto of having little civic identity. Like, um...like, there's all those Persian rug stores. And a weird sculpture of an egg outside Pizza My Heart. And zero parking places! See? TONS of civic identity.

name: bjorntd
text:
Do you also suspect that all those persian rug stores are fronts for illegal activities, which is why there are so many?

Also: a policeman once told me not to knock on the egg.

name: loneal
text: I have been told that one of those Persian rug stores is a front for a Sufi mosque, which is not at all illegal, but I guess kind of cool offbeat religious things need fronts, too.

name: bjorntd
text:
This is true. And you know that restaurant "Pasta?"

Front for the church of the FSM.

name: loneal
text: Of course! It all seems so obvious now!

name: ajg
text: It's the one on California Ave, next to Med Wraps.

name: bjorntd
text: Awesome. I can get a shawerma wrap and my mystical Islam on at the same time.

name: thesyndicate88
text: That Finmish guy believes Ray to be Raymo Smookels, famed inventor.

name: thesyndicate88
text: damnit FinNish. I even double-checked my spelling...

name: streever
text: I think we all just need to agree that misspelling something here isn't that critical. I keep seeing people correcting their spelling, but it's okay, guys. This isn't serious writing. It is just some notes on a comic.

name: wfl
text: but he said that on the internet . If he can't take it back , he better make sure it is at least spelled correctly.. dammit .

name: jamers
text: That strip is nowhere near rated highly enough.

name: ttagxamm
text: Well, panel five merits a five from me, just for the imagery, so nicely bolstered by the alt-text.  Gotta give those decomissioned BMX kids something to do or else they'll turn to collecting vig for the newspaper.

name: mo_rose
text: Is that leander's hat in the bottom right of 3 4?

name: sirptom
text: Excellent catch.  A chubby for you.

name: buttermoths
text: Dang, I KNEW I had seen that hat before. Well done sir, well done.

name: blarghamagarky
text: To me it looked like that really serious political hair part. Like the type John Edwards.

name: falseprophet
text: I agree. John Edwards is a type.

name: blarghamagarky
text:
man I was right accidentally here.

"has"

name: drskradley
text: Oh damn.  Brilliant get.  My kudos and chubbies and stuff.

name: coldfrog
text: Not only is that slick observation, your icon is an impossible tower of dice!  Doth my eyes deceive?  NO! So, chubbies.

name: optimus
text: Ray gets Achewood's priorities in order. He gets things done.

name: professorhazard
text: Oh God, so good to get back to actual Achewood. I don't care if Onstad did last week on purpose just to make today feel so right; it feels so right for Ray to be acting mayor today.

name: misterwolf
text: This totally would happen.

name: maxisadinosaur
text: Britney Spears has gone fucking nuts

text: A comment left by taco was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by sevendaughters, DrSkradley, Baryonyx, Fielding, Audhumla)

name: fielding
text: I felt like "temerity" redeemed him, but to each his own.

name: sevendaughters
text: May God bless all your children with Rolexes and the entire back catalogue of John Coltrane.

name: drskradley
text:
Times are changing these days I think, man. If you be quotin' strips, the classics won't do (except "never be a cock to a stranger." That one has frequent Internet Context).

These days, it's gotta be a kind of quote that makes people who know the quotes feel like they don't know the quotes

I'm not advocating it, I'm just sayin' I see the change, man. I see the change.

name: baryonyx
text: The quote business is suffering from inflation, essentially.

name: sevendaughters
text:
I'd like to articulate my inner pain in the best way; a haiku.

Now entered into
The irony cycle where
The zeitgest owns me

name: fuckyoufriday
text: In Soviet Russia, zeitgeist owns YOU! *buried by flurry of lames*

name: bjorntd
text: WHAT A COUNTRY.

name: trollcollins
text: Ray is the breath of fresh air so badly needed in every municipal government in every town and city in every country in the entire world.

name: steerpike66
text: Rule us like a King, Mayor Smuckles.

name: jargonmaster
text: SIC SEMPER TYRRANUS

name: stuntman
text: "thus ever (or always) to tyrants" -courtesy of wikipedia, for those who were as confused as me.

name: usversusthem
text: SEMPER FIDELIS TYRANNOSAURUS!

name: wittyname
text: Did Ray ever decide if he liked kings, anyways?

name: ajg
text: I think he's on board with telling chicks straight up that he likes them.  Now that he's Mayor, I bet his position on punching hell of suckers in the mouth will be reconsidered.

name: gussiejives

name: synnah
text: Just.. anyone but Todd.

name: lost_buoy
text: Matt Drudge reads Achewood for source material.

name: caddon
text:
SMUCKLES
KAZENZAKIS '08

CHANGE, DOGGS

name: lost_buoy
text:
If only this could be a real ticket, considering.

Chubby for the idealism.

name: lateadopter
text: But those who lurk in silent malignity might lame him for the use of a comma in a Beef-like context.  Besides, the other reading of "CHANGE DOGGS" is perhaps more appropriate for a political slogan.

name: stuntman
text: change them how?

name: lateadopter
text:
As in swapping out old for new, or acquiring for oneself some new doggs now that the old ones have shown that they do not have your back. I supposed you could take the ones you currently have and try to change their characteristics, but you really can't teach an old dogg new tricks.

As expected, I have been struck by a lurking malignancy, but one that is not always silent. The guy has it in for me.

name: sbkidjamx
text: Become the ruling body, dude!

name: kenyot
text: Mr. Smuckles Goes to Washington

name: baryonyx
text: Right up there with Stewart/Colbert and Calvin/Hobbes.

name: ryabovsky
text: Make this bumper sticker happen.

name: nhennies
text: Ray is a member of the Mayor's foursome.

name: senseihollywood
text:
Ray only got "made" into the Mayor's foursome after Leo Fontanette croaked

Here you go...

name: gormster
text: Ray looks an awful lot like Beef in that strip and he is on the phone to himself.

name: irondave
text: The Anarchist's Cookbook has yet to address a countermeasure for high-pressure lemon juice.

name: lost_buoy
text: It's in an addendum under "Chocolate Frosted Sugar Bombs," contributed by some guy named Watterson.

name: jamers
text: Kudos for a wonderful C&H reference!

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
yes.

right after his instructions on how to plan and commit a 'noodle incident.'

this is hilarious.

name: biff
text:
Holy Shit, I need to get laid.

I read that as Chocolate Frosted Sugar Boobs.

Twice!

name: ianmalcolm2
text: Defederalized BMX Black ops riders are the Boy-Scout charity weenie-roast's most feared enemy.

name: epicurus
text: Ray has a lot to reccomend himself over almost all real politicians. Should I be trying to elect Chris Onstad? Maybe kidnap him in the middle of the night and put him behind a podium somewhere and make him run for office?

name: tombsgrave
text: If this is the start of an elaborate arc where Ray ends up running for president, I am so totally hyp't.

name: wonelove
text: and it'd be quite fitting, especially at this time, yeah?

name: baryonyx
text: ... against Philippe .

name: cpnglxynchos
text: would Ray still fund Philippe's campaign? that would be pretty funny. Ray is totally someone that would give his opponent a helping hand, the way he throws money around like when Lyle asks for a hundo. (too rushed to link at the moment. someone else up for it?)

name: biff
text: Lyle's baseball card

name: cpnglxynchos
text: chubbied. thanks!

name: cpnglxynchos
text: ah heck i cannot chubby you proper.

name: foetus_punch
text: Did it for you, man. Because that's just the sort of guy I am.

name: kodiakclock
text: A comment left by kodiakclock was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, divot, phthoggos, robotman, odei, DrSkradley, Miku224)

name: hendetta
text: Mayor C. had a heart-attack because he was so mad over it always bein' Hammertime.

name: gormster
text: I mean, the man's fifty.

name: roger_wilco
text:
I don't care what you guys think%u2014the last three strips were incredible and entertaining and a thoroughly refreshing view inside an artists crazy mind. I'm a little sad to see us back in Achewood "proper."

Good ol' black and white funny type familiar strips like this are good too. But I'm just saying.

name: lost_buoy
text: You just wrote "proper" under a post that mentions "Hammertime." That's 2 legit.

name: roger_wilco
text: It would be best not to even ask what I do when a post mentions "Pumps and a Bump."

name: stuntman
text: yeah and it's nice to see some strips about teodore now and again.  He is way over-shaddowed by ray/beef ongoings.

name: lawbot
text: When full-time mayors aren't enough.

name: kenyot
text:
Ray's connections never cease to amaze me.

I really think this strip will be the start of something beautiful.

name: norrin
text: When you can give away pricey vehicles for random favors, you can make friends in high places pretty easily.

name: minarch
text: Was the heart attack caused by being drenched in hot bloody fat?

name: mrclarinet
text: A comment left by mrclarinet was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Thorfinn, eatmorekix, Wulvaine, SPECTRE)

name: eatmorekix
text: lamed for "President Huckabee"

name: gormster
text: I can no longer lame (why? It's not like I'm doing it all the time. I would love to know the inner workings of Acheworld, Onstad.) so I chubby you instead. President Huckabee? Haha, you're out of your fucking mind. The odds on a Republican being elected are, last I looked, 12:1.

name: gambolholic
text: What's a short-term heart attack as opposed to a long-term heart attack?

name: peterjoel
text: It means he will soon be springing back to relieve Ray from the stress of all that responsibility... Although I have this idea he might have to fight a little...

name: bondijames
text:
In Australia, a short-term heart attack (or other minor cardiac incident causing a few days missed work) is known as "chucking a cardie".

Longer-term events are more death-related.

name: norrin
text: More deathy.

name: peterjoel
text: I love it when the big issues touch a nerve with those in power. Reminds me somewhat of Pitt the Younger's proposed policy of "tougher sentences for Geography teachers."

name: mrclarinet
text: A comment left by mrclarinet was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by VandenBos, biomusicologist, Moolah, Dezufnocosem, Thorfinn, odei, morypcaina, smugairle, foetus_punch, lastlarf, ibetso, rumblefish, SPECTRE)

name: rumblefish
text:
Lamed for attacking Rowan Atkinson's last shred of pride.
Low blow sir, low blow.

name: peterjoel
text: My Heros!

name: mrclarinet
text: He brought it upon himself.

name: moolah
text: Blackadder is in no way hell of terrible. You are terrible. This strip was pretty good, the alt. text was killer.

name: sortelli
text: God fucking dammit, let the people reference Blackadder. If it's not another goddamn quote from the goddamn comic we are reading to demonstrate basic literacy skills to impress a community of douchebags, it is an improvement.

name: fattybeaver
text: I guess sortelli's status of sitting in a chair hating you is actually true.

name: comrade_tom
text: Ray as mayor? thats the last thing Phillipe needs after his recent mayoral fascination. it's just one step to far. its just too far.

name: roboticagent
text:
thank you Onstad

I do hope Ray revises his policies.

name: wulvaine
text:
Onstad is back! And it appears that he is starting an awesome new arc!

The future is bright, and Ray is the people's candidate!

name: baryonyx
text: Hmm, it's nice to have the usual format back, but I'm having trouble enjoying this one...part of my brain is automatically digging around for some heavy-handed commentary on modern day politics, while the rest of it is saying "C'mon man, knock it off. This is Achewood."

name: norrin
text:
Offtopic nonsense-

With the name baryonyx I have to assume you are the opposite of Barry White. Thus, you are pale white, have a high pitch voice, are stick thin and get nowhere with the ladies.

I hope I am wrong.

name: biff
text:
Wouldn't the opposite of baryonx be darkmatterx ?

Although the Barry White joke was a bit humorous.

name: spectre
text: Oh, to have a chubby left! I thin my new screen name will be "bosonx".

name: flash1087
text:
Even if that's not him, I pretty much am that guy, so you're not completely off.

Hey, while we're taking stabs at baryonyx's online persona, is your avatar supposed to be The Sandman?

name: baryonyx
text:
My avatar is an unnamed, dapperly dressed man, his face adorned with a gas-mask (see fig. 1). The name "Baryonyx" bears no connection to the name or person of Barry White, and is instead in homage to Baryonyx, the most awesome dinosaur, ever (see fig. 2).

Fig. 1
[IMGS OFF]


Fig. 2
[IMGS OFF]

This concludes my presentation on the identifying characteristics of my Assetbar account. Any questions?

name: flash1087
text: Ah, nuts. I thought I was right on the Sandman thing. Close enough for me, though.

name: baryonyx
text: Hm, with good reason...perhaps the fellow in my icon is actually dressed up as him and I didn't realize it. Either way, you just made me really want to start reading Sandman.

name: flash1087
text: DO IT! It's amazing. If you've got a halfway decent comic shop in town, the stuff you want is called Sandman Mystery Theatre. Each of the stories are contained within 2-4 part arcs so it's not hard to drop in wherever, but I recommend starting at the beginning.

name: baryonyx
text: Seriously, "A gas gun, prophetic dreams, highly honed detective skills and a fair knowledge of the martial arts"? I can get behind this. Unfortunately the closest-at-hand library only had copies of the Neil Gaiman Sandman, and I was not intrigued. No gas-mask. Where is the gas-mask.

name: flash1087
text: Man, that's not even the same guy. Oh, and while we're on the subject, Gaiman wrote some half-assed crossover to try to link Dodds' dreams to his Sandman, and it's not good.

name: tekende
text:
You mean the Doll's House storyline? That story was awesome.

Retract, dude. Retract.

name: baryonyx
text:
Oh my goodness. I just read the first volume of Mystery Theatre. I have a new favorite superhero.

I am in your debt. And your postulations about my icon have become correct.

name: cleave
text: The best part of your dinosaur is that it was discovered in a city called Dorking.

name: drskradley
text:
I always knew what you were, dude.
[IMGS OFF]

I always knew...

name: baryonyx
text: High-five!

name: drskradley
text:
Hella back slappin'. We totally got this from the same place. Our minds, is connected.

I was gonna put up hella pictures of dinosaurs like a schoolkid showing my favourites, but then I didn't. Baryonyx is, indeed, one of the baddest. I always like Deinocheirus though, just for the mystery...

[IMGS OFF]
(Because that's all they found!)

The local museum has a copy of them, they're a good 8-foot long. They stopped showing them recently and thus have them up the back. I'm attempting to get a job there just to frequent the back storage area and sit and bask in the awesome on my lunch break.

This is the plan, anyway.

name: baryonyx
text:
Damn. That thing could fight a truck. Obviously they were just too awesome for the public eye? Or did they just say, what the hell, as long as this much is left to the imagination, why not?

I'm totally down for an in-depth Comparative Dinosaurs discussion, right now. Some of the other greats:

Dilophosaurus:
[IMGS OFF]


Theizinosaurus
[IMGS OFF]


Styracosaurus
[IMGS OFF]

name: drskradley
text:
Oh hell yes!

We doin this!

Not a dinosaur, but much respect must go to the largest predator EVER:

Liopleurodon
[IMGS OFF]
[IMGS OFF]


The Lion of the Jurassic - Allosaurus
[IMGS OFF]

Pack hunter extraordinaire, Deinonychus (here, an artistic representation of that famous fossil find where a pack of them died while ripping the shit out of a Tenontosaurus)
[IMGS OFF]

And despite not being during the age of dinosaurs, the "terror bird" Phorusrhacos would freak the ever-loving shit out of me because such a creature should not, truly, exist.
[IMGS OFF]

name: peterjoel
text: A comment left by peterjoel was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by seven47, Thorfinn, foetus_punch)

name: foetus_punch
text: A comment left by foetus_punch was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, Ravenmancer, Comrade_Tom, slalvation)

name: flash1087
text:
If you were near me in person and I heard you praising Golden Age Sandman over Gaiman's bullshit, you'd recieve the heartiest high-five of your life.

So if there's ever a Great Achewood Meetup, I'll owe you one. In the meantime, here's a CHUBBY!

name: sicsemper
text: I can't add anything except right on. I even like Gaiman, but seriously, Wesley Dodds FTW.

name: vandenbos
text:
Not to be the voice of dissent, but Matt Wagner really retroactively made Wesley Dodds a great character with Sandman Mystery Theatre. Prior to that, the best thing he had going for him was the phenomenal pulp-hero outfit. And then he got the banana costume:

[IMGS OFF]

Still, I can't really hold the fact that it took fifty-some-odd years for a creator to come along and actually realize his potential against him.
(Okay, I'm finished. Sorry, can't resist jumping into a nice geeky discussion.)

name: flash1087
text:
Alright, his pre-'acrobat outfit' stuff rules. I will concede that's a big problem with a lot of Golden Age dudes, they're all good concepts with hideous execution. Dr. Mid-Nite had the same problem, and I don't like any Starman except Jack Knight.

Did you ever read the SMT arc that introduces Hourman? Wagner rips into Dodds' other costume hardcore.

name: slalvation
text: Life is more fun if how much you like things has nothing to do with who else likes them.

name: tekende
text: Amen!

name: norrin
text: I am out of chubbies, friend.

name: spinynorman
text: That should be on office walls and bumper stickers.

name: foetus_punch
text:
Alright, you lamed me. And I can only assume that you enjoy Neil Gaiman. But...that is a brilliant thing to say, and I respect you.

Neil Gaiman still blows.

name: stormagnet
text: Are.. are you seriously saying that you neither like nor respect Dinosaur Comics anymore based on the sole criteria that other people like it? I mean, even if you neither like nor respect those people, that's just fucked.

name: foetus_punch
text: No, dude. I don't like dinosaur comics anymore based on the criteria that the author obviously thinks himself quite the clever fellow, and it shows, and everyone who reads it somehow believes themselves to have become intelligent. I recently gave it another chance, and although it can occasionally crack wise, it is for the most part a depressing ego trip.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: a magical Liopleurodon, Charlie!

name: drskradley
text: I showed that cartoon to my wife, who didn't find it funny.  Perhaps because I was sitting next to her giggling at stupidity and thus there was far too much expectation.

name: biff
text:
Some kids in the Digital Media class were watching that, and I sang along with the Candy Mountain song, and they accused me of smoking pot.

Not that there is anything wrong with smoking pot, but I don't do that any more.

name: norrin
text: There is something wrong with it. You become an even more lazy bum than you were to begin with. And, in some cases, it's all you talk about.

name: nosearmy
text: are you talking about pot or Neil Gaiman?

name: gormster
text: Correction: there is nothing wrong with smoking pot occasionally . Anything is bad if it becomes an addiction.

name: baryonyx
text: Not if you become addicted to HUUUUUUUUGS.

name: i_love_kate
text: Tell that to my parole officer.

name: biomusicologist
text:
Holy shit man, that's some damn dedication for that long-ass post about dinosaurs. Also, that Liopleurodon looks fucking awesome, especially whilst leaping from the sea to devour that hapless dinosaur mindlessly strolling on the beach.
Chubbied.

name: baryonyx
text:
That picture of Lipleurodon just destroying a plesiosaur...wow. That is oh so very intense. I might want to hold on to that for future use.

Deinonychus is another favorite from old times, to the point where it just goes without saying. Velociraptor was too small, Utahraptor was too big, and Deinonychus was juuust riiight.

name: drskradley
text:
Deinonychus truly IS from old times. Back when we knew it was cool, before Jurassic Park came out. Utahraptor really was too big. I mean, 22 feet long? Kinda ruins the point, if you ask me.

Have you seen how they're portraying such as those sorta dinosaurs nowadays? With the crazy-ass Brazilian Mardi Gras feathers? It's not right, I tell you. It's not right.

I mean, sure, I see the science behind it - it may be scientifically correct , but morally and ethically, we all know it's wrong.

Fuck that meteor, man.

name: baryonyx
text:
The feathers! Don't get me started on the feathers. Times are changing, man. These ain't your old man's dinosaurs no more. Give me a good old-fashioned unfeathered dinosaur any day. To prove the point:

RIGHT
[IMGS OFF]
Scaly, harbinger-of-death Thunder Lizard

WRONG
[IMGS OFF]
Lead singer of some fucked up dinosaur techno band

I must say, Walking with Dinosaurs was a fondly remembered four hours. Ever watch it? I'm pretty sure the whole thing's on YouTube nowadays.

name: drskradley
text:
That, truly, is a Terrible Lizard. And not in the cool, Victorian way. It's just terrible. It. Is. Terrible.

Oh my yes, I watched Walking with Dinosaurs . Luckily even got it for Christmas (on VHS, alas!). I even saw the live show - not enough blood and sex for my liking, considering I was watching a live-action speculative nature documentary, but it was still pretty awesome.

Ever seen Walking with Monsters , about the time before dinosaurs, in the Paleozoic. Earth is a weird, weird place.

name: baryonyx
text: As a matter of fact I did see Walking with Monsters . Very weird indeed. Of course, it didn't get nearly the funding of Dinosaurs and it definitely showed, because honestly, who cares about monsters when you've got dinosaurs.

name: drskradley
text: But... Dimetrodons, dude - Dimetrodons!

name: baryonyx
text:
Well...I do like Dimetrodons...
But they were a prime example! All gliding crazily over the ground and having babies that you know are just adult Dimetrodons shrunk way down to save time...the execution could've been better. That is all I will say.

Also, I want to watch Walking with Prehistoric Beasts now to find out more about this so-called "Phorusrhacos." Indeed a thing of nightmares.

Ah, Assetbar. You make my trips to the YouTube comment threads ever so depressing.

name: drskradley
text:
Oh, I found your video right here. *

Also, I don't believe it was on Walking with Beasts , I think it was on Prehistoric Park , which I found enjoyable enough.

*Some depictions are scarier than others.

name: drskradley
text:
Nope, Wikipedia says that it was on both.

Prehistoric Park falsely claims that Smilodon forced Phorusrhacos into extinction, if the Wikifacts are anything to go by.

name: foetus_punch
text: Walking with Dinosaurs was sweet. I own the book. If you liked that, mayhaps you might enjoy The Future is Wild. Another great production that makes me feel like a child. Also, I must say that I love this community. We just had an immense conversation about dinosaurs, comics, and online humor. We are all children. But that's okay.

name: baryonyx
text: I heard about The Future is Wild! Really wanted to see that, looked great. What with twenty-story tortoises and bird-lizards with mouths within their mouths .

name: foetus_punch
text: There is a book! The cover makes it look like a shitty fishing book, with a trout or something jumping out of some water...until your eyes catch onto the fact that the trout is a fish-bird monster with no place in god's plan. No place but awesome, that is.

name: drskradley
text: And hot damn, that Rainbow Squid!

name: foetus_punch
text: Ooooh, that Rainbow Squid! My favorite: the god damn MEGASQUID. The ocean flish? Also sweet.

name: atticusonline
text:
did you just refer to Carnival as "Brazilian Mardi Gras"?

shame on you.

name: loneal
text: Chubbied because I had totally forgotten about Styracosaurus. I can't believe I ever forgot about Styracosaurus.

name: baryonyx
text: Styracosaurus: it's like Triceratops, but even better!

name: echidnaboy
text: Precisely. Styracosaurus was always my fave, closely followed by Iguanadon, the most optimistic of all dinosaurs.

name: drskradley
text:
I wish I were not out of chubbies to give you both for the most accurate description of Styracosaurus. This is the exact sentiment of every 4-year-old boy and girl dinosaur lover in the world.

And Iguanadon - yes, perfect explanation. Still - dude, that thumb spike, he would fuck your shit up.

[IMGS OFF]

He was quick, like ninja. He took no shit.

name: biff
text: This totally looks like foreplay.

name: alzuna
text:
My first thoughts were that the Iguanadon was some sort of doctor and he was performing an examination.

I like yours better.

name: atticusonline
text: That's his "go-to shank"

name: notapc
text: I assume Ray will be running on the Toilet Party ticket?

name: rumblefish
text: Will Blackwater be providing the BMX riders do you think, or will Ray be providing contracts to his own, brand new, security firm?

name: flash1087
text:
YOU'VE TOUCHED A NERVE, JOURNALIST!

A nerve so great that Ray needs only to identify the asker by his profession. Good dialouge, as always.

Does anyone else hope this becomes an arc? I want Mayor Smuckles to be a thing.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: if this keeps up, it will only exacerbate Philippe's Mayor curiosity.

name: rumblefish
text:
Or end it once and for all.
I imagine the mayoral mystique fades a little once you've seen the mayor watching Braveheart in only a thong, scratching as nature dictates.

name: flash1087
text: SCANDAL ERUPTS IN ACHEWOOD AS ACTING MAYOR SMUCKLES SEEN IN UNDERGROUND BREAKDANCING FOOTAGE

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
OH DAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAMN.

good one.

name: drskradley
text: I could have sworn I chubbied this.  But still, chubbies are due.

name: flash1087
text: Thanks. Would you believe that was the first Achewood I ever read?

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
it may...or could make him see that hey, Ray can do it. and i'm a friend of Ray. i could be Mayor, too! totally cool!


a lot can come out of this comic.

name: flash1087
text: President Phillippe didn't work out because he had no experience. Mayor Phillippe first, then maybe Congressman Phillippe.

name: shades
text: an easy 5

name: johnnyc
text: The main cat discovers that the best way to answer difficult questions is to suggest that they are e-mailed, and the best way to answer easy questions is directly.

name: wae
text: Finnish Cousins: THE Worst.

name: weapon86
text: "Mr.Mayor, how do you think Achewood citizens will react when they learn your home was profited by... ancient porn ?"

name: cpnglxynchos
text: That is a completely rad question. You get one hundred thousand dollars for asking it. Come by my house someday to pick up the check and to have some Ketel One with me.

name: tvision
text: Yay! Just finished reading through the archives. Is there a prize?

name: audhumla
text: You get to do it again in Assetbar, since according to this you have viewed a total of three strips.

name: mightymeliel
text: Indeed. A Chubby. Well done.

name: biff
text: Also, you should schedule regular rereadings.  I try to do it at least twice a year.

name: captainphaze
text: Smuckles '08 - Year of the Cat! VOTE RAY!!!

name: opprobrium
text:
you know what's funny about having a mayor? being able to say "mayoral". think about it.

ah, AH?? i see you smilin'.

name: lateadopter
text: Dude, cut down on the caffeine.  You got the shakes somethin' fierce.

name: comrade_tom
text: just so long as ray doesnt write himself a "tell all" autobiography like Obama did, I'm not sure i could handle a 300 page volume of reminiscences about "tough customer" ham snack pockets.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: I like the reference to the old political technique of deflecting a probing question by praising the insightfulness of the question itself. Ray is definitely charismatic and deceitful enough to be the next (Bill) Clinton.

name: henrythecad
text:
Ray Smuckles... Mayor... holy shit, this is awesome.

Life is hilarious!

name: bjorntd
text: Wait... what the crap. De-fede rail ized? Is this a typo, or intentional?

name: fuckyoufriday
text: That's you being wrong.

name: bjorntd
text:
But I could have sworn...!

Whatever. It was late. My contacts were dry. Some excuse that would adequately explain away the failure of my eyesight. This is the internet, I cannot take back my shortcomings, I can only hope that others learn from them.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: It happens. I didn't mean to imply superiority.

name: ravenmancer
text: What really made this strip for me is that Ray's only real qualification for the position was being a member of the Mayor's foursome.

name: flash1087
text: Yeah...who are the other guys and how was Ray a better choice than any of them?

name: sardoniclaconic
text: Previously, Ray expressed similar feelings in a fuck you friday:

name: sardoniclaconic
text:
I'm worse with computers than Ray is.
This is the best I can do:
http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uua3MLR7F

name: cpnglxynchos
text: The FUF

name: sardoniclaconic
text: thanks

name: agentstinky
text: Strips like this make me realize how infrequently you actually see the word "Achewood" in the strip itself.
